docs.lead_paragraph: Earlier this year, the Westinghouse Electric Corporation obtained from the Philippines what appeared to be one of its circuit breakers, a widely used device that automatically cuts off electric power in case of overloading to prevent fire and shocks. It bore the Westinghouse trademark, was the correct size and shape and carried the right serial number. But testing showed it to be a dangerous fake, incapable of doing what a genuine Westinghouse circuit breaker should do. That is just one example of large- scale industrial counterfeiting that was presented at a meeting here last month of American and European manufacturers intent on bringing the phenomenon under control.
